questions.question: When transitioning from 1-on-1 coaching to a group coaching model, which metric typically sees the most significant improvement for the coach?
options: Individual client customization depth
Revenue per hour worked (Leverage)
Total number of hours spent on Zoom
Reduction in software subscription costs
questions.explanation: Group coaching allows a coach to serve multiple clients simultaneously, significantly increasing the revenue generated for every hour of delivery compared to the 1-on-1 model.

questions.question: In the 'Value Ladder' strategy for digital products, what is the primary purpose of a 'Tripwire' product (e.g., a $27 Fertility Meal Plan)?
options: To generate the majority of the business's annual profit
To provide a comprehensive 12-month medical solution
To convert a lead into a paying customer and build initial trust
To replace the need for any high-ticket coaching services
questions.explanation: A tripwire is a low-cost, high-value product designed to convert a prospect into a customer, psychologically lowering the barrier for future high-ticket purchases.

questions.question: When establishing referral networks with REIs (Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility specialists), which approach is considered most ethical and professional?
options: Offering the doctor a $500 'kickback' for every patient referred
Focusing on bi-directional value and improved patient outcomes/compliance
Insisting that the doctor only uses your specific brand of supplements
Sharing private client medical records without a signed release form
questions.explanation: Professional medical partnerships should be based on collaborative care and patient outcomes; financial kickbacks are often unethical and, in some jurisdictions, illegal (e.g., Anti-Kickback Statute).

questions.question: A fertility coach's calendar is 90% full with administrative tasks and client sessions. According to Lesson 4, who should typically be their first 'Scaling' hire?
options: A second Senior Fertility Coach
A full-time Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
An Administrative Virtual Assistant (VA)
A professional Video Production Team
questions.explanation: To scale, a coach must first delegate low-value administrative tasks (email, scheduling, basic tech) to a VA to free up 'Zone of Genius' time for high-value coaching and strategy.

questions.question: What is a defining characteristic of a 'High-Ticket VIP Concierge' service in fertility coaching?
options: It is the lowest priced item on the value ladder
It relies exclusively on pre-recorded evergreen webinars
It offers high-proximity support, such as priority messaging and 'done-for-you' logistics
It is designed for the largest possible number of simultaneous participants
questions.explanation: VIP services are characterized by high proximity, exclusivity, and 'white-glove' support that removes the logistical burden from the client.

questions.question: Within the F.E.R.T.I.L.E. Method™ workflow, which process is the most critical to automate first to ensure a premium client experience?
options: The actual coaching breakthroughs and emotional support
The onboarding sequence (contracts, intake forms, and portal access)
The creation of unique social media posts for every client
The diagnosis of reproductive pathologies
questions.explanation: Automating the onboarding sequence ensures that the client feels supported immediately after payment and that all legal/data requirements are met without manual delays.

questions.question: In Lesson 7, the 'Rule of One' for authority-building content marketing suggests that a signature talk should focus on:
options: One hundred different fertility tips
One core problem, one core solution, and one clear call to action
One hour of technical medical jargon
One single platform (only Instagram)
questions.explanation: The 'Rule of One' ensures clarity and impact in public speaking, focusing the audience on a single transformational path rather than overwhelming them with data.

questions.question: If your Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) is $400 and your client's Lifetime Value (LTV) is $4,000, what is your LTV:CAC ratio?
questions.explanation: LTV ($4,000) divided by CAC ($400) equals a 10:1 ratio, which indicates a highly profitable and scalable marketing model.

questions.question: Which KPI (Key Performance Indicator) is most essential for monitoring the health of a recurring fertility membership site?
options: Monthly Churn Rate
Number of 'Likes' on the last post
Color palette consistency
Total number of pages in the workbook
questions.explanation: Churn rate measures the percentage of members leaving the program; high churn indicates a problem with retention or perceived value, which can kill a membership model.

questions.question: When scaling to a 'Team-Lead' model, what is the primary role of the founder/owner?
options: To personally answer every client email
To act as the 'Visionary' and maintain quality control/brand standards
To perform all the technical coding for the website
To avoid all involvement in the business operations
questions.explanation: As the business scales, the founder must transition from 'the person doing the work' to the 'Visionary' who sets the direction and ensures the team maintains the F.E.R.T.I.L.E. Method™ standards.
